basics.name: Nélida Silvero
basics.label: PhD
basics.summary: I hold a PhD in Soil Science and Plant Nutrition from the University of São Paulo, Brazil. I was a Visiting Scholar at the Iowa State University, in the United States, where I worked with digital mapping of drainage classes.

In January 2022, I was awarded the Newton International Fellowship from The Royal Society and I'll be join the University of Leeds as a Research Fellow. There, I'll be conducting research with the main aim to understand soil carbon spatio-temporal dynamics in agricultural systems to support decision making under climate change.
